item.title: 钻石背公司希望利用天然气为油区发电
item.description: 二叠纪盆地最大的石油公司之一 Diamondback 能源公司正在考虑利用其生产的部分天然气发电，以运行钻井和压裂作业。【原文：Diamondback Energy Inc., one of the Permian Basin’s biggest oil companies, is considering using some of the natural gas it produces to generate electricity to run drilling and fracking operations.】

item.title: 索尼加入日本推动加密货币发展的行列，要求放宽规则的呼声日益高涨
item.description: 娱乐巨头索尼集团公司（Sony Group Corp. ）是最新一家加入日本企业利用区块链技术大潮的公司，这一趋势给日本政府带来了挑战。【原文：Entertainment giant Sony Group Corp. is the latest company to jump onto a bandwagon of Japanese businesses seeking to tap blockchain technology, a trend that poses challenges for the nation’s government.】

item.title: 经纪人退还阿根廷幽灵债券利润 1,000 万美元
item.description: 当地一家经纪公司是阿根廷今年创纪录的比索债务置换交易中获得 20% 收益的投资者之一，该公司将从该交易中获得的近 1000 万美元利润返还给了政府。【原文：A local brokerage that was among investors who made 20% gains in Argentina’s record peso debt swap this year returned the nearly $10 million in profit it made from the deal to the government.】

item.title: 史蒂夫-科恩停止为 Point72 交易，标志着一个时代的结束
item.description: 史蒂夫-科恩（Steve Cohen）离开了交易大厅。【原文：Steve Cohen has stepped away from the trading floor.】

item.title: 冈德拉克认为美联储 "在曲线之后 "将降息半点
item.description: DoubleLine Capital 的杰弗里-冈德拉克（Jeffrey Gundlach）加入了越来越多的人的行列，他们打赌美联储将在周三以半个百分点的降息幅度启动其降息周期。【原文：DoubleLine Capital’s Jeffrey Gundlach joined the growing ranks of those wagering that the Federal Reserve will kick off its interest-rate cutting cycle with a half-percentage-point move on Wednesday.】

item.title: PS5 Pro 的价格令 PlayStation 诞生国大跌眼镜
item.description:
日本可能创造了 PlayStation 品牌，但最新一代游戏机的成本将把所有玩家排除在外，只有最铁杆的玩家除外。【原文：

Japan might have created the PlayStation brand, but the cost of the latest generation of console will exclude all but the most hardcore. 

】

item.title: 微软称拜登退出竞选后，俄罗斯的影响力活动转向哈里斯
item.description: 根据微软公司的最新研究，在乔-拜登总统结束重返白宫的竞选活动后，俄罗斯影响美国大选的努力转向了用篡改和误导性视频抹黑副总统卡马拉-哈里斯。【原文：After President Joe Biden ended his campaign to return to the White House, Russian efforts to influence the US election shifted to smearing Vice President Kamala Harris with doctored and misleading videos, according to new research from Microsoft Corp.】

item.title: 尽管加拿大矿业受到打击，中国紫金集团仍誓言继续投资加拿大矿业
item.description: 中国最有价值的矿业公司紫金矿业集团股份有限公司（Zijin Mining Group Co.【原文：Zijin Mining Group Co., China’s most valuable mining company, says it won’t be deterred by the Canadian government’s measures to limit foreign involvement in its mining sector.】

item.title: 法国央行预测明年通胀率将降至 1.5
item.description: 法国央行下调了对明年法国通胀率的预测，使其远低于欧洲央行 2% 的目标，这使得鼓励决策者继续降息的信号更加强烈。【原文：The Bank of France cut its forecast for French inflation next year to well below the European Central Bank’s 2% target, adding to signals encouraging policymakers to pursue interest-rate cuts.】

item.title: Snap 价值 1200 美元的 AR 眼镜使用起来很有趣，但需要更多应用程序
item.description: Snap 公司再次尝试让智能眼镜成为时尚。【原文：Snap Inc. is trying, again, to make smart glasses trendy.】

item.title: Snap 推出新款智能眼镜，重新推动增强现实技术发展
item.description: Snap Inc.首席执行官埃文-斯皮格尔（Evan Spiegel）周二发布了该公司新版 Spectacles 智能眼镜，重振了该公司打造先进增强现实产品的努力，这种产品有朝一日可能会取代或匹敌智能手机。【原文：Snap Inc. Chief Executive Officer Evan Spiegel unveiled a new version of the company’s Spectacles smart glasses Tuesday, revitalizing an effort to build an advanced augmented reality product that may one day replace or rival the smartphone.】

item.title: TikTok 正在成为美国成年人喜爱的新闻来源
item.description: 一项新的调查显示，TikTok 正在成为包括年轻人在内的越来越多美国人的固定新闻来源，这表明越来越多的人开始使用这款视频应用程序进行在线政治辩论。【原文：TikTok is becoming a regular news source for a growing number of Americans, including young adults, according to a new survey, a sign more people are turning to the video app for online debate about politics.】

item.title: 摩根大通加入高盛欲出售苹果卡的诉讼方行列
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）正在与苹果公司商讨接管竞争对手高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. is in discussions with Apple Inc. about taking over a credit card portfolio that rival Goldman Sachs Group Inc. has been trying to ditch.】

item.title: AT&T 同意为云数据泄漏支付 1300 万美元 FCC 罚款
item.description: AT&T Inc.同意支付 1300万美元，以了结美国联邦通信委员会对该电信公司是否未能保护去年云供应商被黑客窃取的客户数据的调查。【原文：AT&T Inc. agreed to pay $13 million to settle an investigation by the US Federal Communications Commission into whether the telecommunications company failed to protect customer data that was stolen when a cloud vendor was hacked last year.】

item.title: 摩根大通称巴西紧缩周期将不及市场预期
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan & Chase Co.）拉美经济研究主管表示，由于美联储的宽松周期为风险资产提供了 "金锁 "情景，巴西的加息幅度将低于交易员的预期。【原文：Brazil will raise interest rates less than traders expect as the Federal Reserve’s easing cycle provides a ‘Goldilocks’ scenario for risk assets, according to the head of Latin America economic research at JPMorgan & Chase Co.】

item.title: 品牌整合商 SellerX 的贷款人取消拍卖，继续债务谈判
item.description: 总部位于柏林的 SellerX 的贷款人周二取消了拍卖这家品牌聚合商的计划，转而选择继续与这家陷入困境的公司的股东进行债务谈判。【原文：Lenders to Berlin-based SellerX canceled a plan to auction off the brand aggregator on Tuesday, opting instead to continue debt negotiations with shareholders of the struggling company.】

item.title: 摩根大通聘请花旗银行的雷蒙迪担任美洲 SIG M&A 部主管
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）从花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co. has hired Ray Raimondi from Citigroup Inc. to lead its mergers and acquisitions business focused on private equity firms and sovereign wealth funds in the Americas.】

item.title: Snap 更新视频源，与 Meta 和 TikTok 竞争
item.description: Snap 公司宣布重新设计其流行的 Snapchat 应用程序，包括更新视频内容的排名和推荐算法，这是为了更好地与 TikTok 和 Meta Platforms 公司的 Instagram 等竞争对手竞争而实施的计划的一部分。【原文：Snap Inc. announced a redesign of its popular Snapchat app, including an updated algorithm for ranking and recommending video content, part of a plan to better compete with rivals like TikTok and Meta Platforms Inc.’s Instagram.】

item.title: 利洁时开始就出售 60 亿英镑家庭护理资产进行谈判
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，利洁时集团（Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc）已开始就其家庭护理资产与一些潜在的收购方进行早期讨论，该资产的交易价格可能超过 60 亿英镑（79 亿美元）。【原文：Reckitt Benckiser Group Plc has started early discussions with some of the potential suitors for its homecare assets, which could fetch more than £6 billion ($7.9 billion) in a deal, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国商品期货交易委员会正在审查有美国交易者参与的境外投注平台
item.description: 一家顶级金融监管机构正在密切关注那些允许美国人就美国大选结果进行交易的不受监管的离岸公司。【原文：A top financial regulator is closely monitoring offshore, unregulated companies that allow Americans to trade on US election outcomes.】

item.title: 麦格理考虑出售价值 16 亿美元的 Wavenet 股份
item.description: 据知情人士透露，麦格理集团（Macquarie Group Ltd.）正在考虑出售英国 IT 服务提供商 Wavenet 的股份，该公司的交易价值可能达到或超过 12 亿英镑（16 亿美元）。【原文：Macquarie Group Ltd. is weighing a stake sale in Wavenet, an IT services provider in the UK, which could be valued at £1.2 billion ($1.6 billion) or more in a deal, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 雪佛龙首席执行官以成本和排放为由抨击拜登暂停液化天然气出口
item.description: 雪佛龙公司（Chevron Corp.首席执行官迈克-沃思（Mike Wirth）呼吁拜登政府撤销停止发放新的液化天然气出口许可证的决定，称这一政策是失败的，"将政治凌驾于进步之上"。【原文：Chevron Corp. Chief Executive Officer Mike Wirth called on the Biden administration to reverse its decision to halt new export licenses for liquefied natural gas, labeling the policy as a failure that “elevates politics over progress.”】

item.title: 破产的黄牌卡车司机因 65 亿美元养老金债务而败诉
item.description: 破产的卡车司机 Yellow Corp. 及其对冲基金所有者在一项关键的法庭裁决中败诉，养老基金声称这家已倒闭的公司欠他们 65 亿美元的债务，这很可能使股东的大部分追偿权化为乌有。【原文：Bankrupt trucker Yellow Corp. and its hedge fund owners lost a key court ruling over $6.5 billion in debt that pension funds claim the defunct company owes them, likely wiping out most recovery for shareholders.】

item.title: 特朗普 SPAC 创始人奥兰多赢得媒体公司更多股份
item.description: 在联邦监管机构指控唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的社交媒体公司上市两个月后，特拉华州一家法院裁定这位前公司负责人再获得约 80 万股特朗普传媒科技集团股份有限公司（Trump Media & Technology Group Corp.【原文：The former head of the firm that took Donald Trump’s social media company public was awarded about 800,000 more shares of Trump Media & Technology Group Corp. by a Delaware court, two months after federal regulators accused him of misleading investors.】

item.title: 五角大楼为军用芯片研究拨款 2.69 亿美元
item.description: 五角大楼将向全美 33 个芯片研究项目拨款 2.69 亿美元，这是该计划第二次拨款，该计划旨在加强军方的半导体研发工作。【原文：The Pentagon will award $269 million to 33 chip research projects across the US, marking the second disbursement of funds from a program designed to bolster semiconductor efforts for the military.】

item.title: 首席运营官称纽蒙特有望从资产出售中获得至少 20 亿美元收益
item.description: 全球最大的黄金开采商纽蒙特公司（Newmont Corp.【原文：Newmont Corp., the world’s biggest gold miner, said it’s on track to raise $2 billion — if not more — from selling smaller mines and development projects.】

item.title: 联合爱马仕称，英国央行需要缓解回购机制的污名化问题
item.description: Federated Hermes 全球流动性市场首席投资官黛比-坎宁安（Debbie Cunningham）认为，英格兰银行需要改变人们的看法，即其对银行的流动性贷款机制主要是危机管理工具。【原文：The Bank of England needs to shift the perception that its liquidity facilities for banks are primarily crisis-management tools, according to Debbie Cunningham, chief investment officer for global liquidity markets at Federated Hermes.】

item.title: 比特币在美联储降息的乐观情绪中创下一个多月来最大涨幅
item.description: 随着人们对美联储降低借贷利率将刺激投机性资产需求的预期增加，比特币的涨幅创下了一个多月以来的最大值。【原文：Bitcoin rose the most in more than a month as expectations increase that a reduction in borrowing rates by the Federal Reserve will boost demand for speculative assets.】

item.title: 荷兰政府降低所得税以提高购买力
item.description: 荷兰政府表示，将降低所得税以提高购买力，并重新引入外籍人士以前享有的一些福利，以改善商业环境。【原文：The Dutch government said it will lower income tax to boost purchasing power and reintroduce some of the perks previously enjoyed by expatriates to improve the business climate.】

item.title: 欧盟挑选曾协助制定社交媒体规则的技术执法者
item.description: 欧盟拟任命的新数字主管是一位资深的芬兰立法者，她在制定约束大科技公司的规则方面发挥了核心作用，这将与她更张扬的前任形成鲜明对比，而她的前任已于一天前辞职以示抗议。【原文：The European Union’s proposed new digital chief is a veteran Finnish lawmaker who was central in crafting rules reining in Big Tech and will be a marked contrast to her more flamboyant predecessor, who resigned in protest a day earlier.】
